title: 108_hr3495
content: Section 629 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act is amended to establish an Emergency Preparedness Demonstration Program to assist disadvantaged communities. The Director will establish an emergency preparedness demonstration program to help disadvantaged communities improve their capacity for emergency response. Grants will be provided to eligible nonprofit organizations to conduct research on emergency preparedness and disaster response awareness in urban and rural areas most affected by disasters. The program aims to develop and promote emergency preparedness education programs in disadvantaged communities through culturally competent materials. Eligible organizations must be nonprofit organizations serving disadvantaged communities. The program provides grants to nonprofit organizations serving disadvantaged communities to acquire professional services, develop informational materials for emergency preparedness, and establish consortia with national organizations. The program aims to promote emergency preparedness in disadvantaged communities by disseminating information, establishing consortia with national organizations, and implementing joint projects with institutions serving disadvantaged individuals. The program promotes emergency preparedness in disadvantaged communities by working with institutions serving disadvantaged individuals. To be eligible for funding, organizations must submit an application with required information. Definitions include disadvantaged business enterprise and disadvantaged community. The curr_chunk defines terms like disadvantaged community, disadvantaged individual, and HUBZone. It also authorizes appropriations for fiscal years 2004 through 2007.
